windows.symptom: iPhone photo import failure. "Something went wrong"        On several iPhones I have, I am trying to import 1000's of pictures into Microsoft Photos. I get the "Something went wrong" error. The solution is to unselect the pictures it doesn't like and then the import works fine. How do I determine which one(s) to unselect? Is there a log file or a sequence at which it imports so I can more easily figure out were the problem is?
solutions: On iPhone go to Settings | Photos | Transfer to Mac or PC.I've found if "Automatic" is selected and the iPhone storage is full or nearly full I have problems transferring as  the iPhone tries to convert the images to .jpg files. Since changing the option to "Keep Originals" I haven't had problems transferring.You can get a free addin from the Microsoft store to work with .heic files.https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/heif-image-extensions/9pmmsr1cgpwg?activetab=pivot:overviewtab

Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. We understand you get an error “Something went wrong”, when importing Photos from iPhone using Microsoft Photos App. Adding to GoBYU suggestions, here is some additional information that you may want to check. Since you are importing 1000’s of photos at a time, this could be the reason you are receiving the error. We would suggest you to importing the photos in batches of 250-300 photos at a time and see if it works for you. Couple of our users were also able to fix the issue by changing the file permissions for the Pictures folder. We can also try changing file permissions and see if that makes a difference. Please refer to the steps mentioned below: Right click on the Pictures folder and selectProperties. Click on Security Tab, click on your username and click onEdit.Select Full Control check box and click onOK. However, if iCloud is enabled on your iOS device, you won’t be able to download your photos or videos. Your images exist on iCloud but not on your device. If you want to open or import these photos or videos to your PC, do so using the iCloud desktop app. For more information, see Import photos and videos from phone to PC. Let us know the results.  Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator
Now when I try to import the pictures, it finds them and then the photos app just freezes.

Hi, Thank you for replying. As you have mentioned that the Photos app freezes when you try to import pictures, we would suggest you to try the steps mentioned below and see if that helps: Connect the iPhone to the computer.Press Windows key + X, and selectDevice Manager.Now, expand Portable Devices, right click oniPhone device and select Uninstall device.Now, click on Action and select Scan for hardware changes. This will install the drivers. Once the drivers are installed, try importing the photos.  If the issue persists, we would suggest you to refer the steps mentioned in the articleFix problems with apps from Microsoft Store and see if that helps. Let us know how it goes.  Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator

This is not a windows 10 issue !!!On your IPhone go to settings > apple ID, Itunes & app store > icloud > photos > turn all off (might have to delete the information so make sure you have saved what you need from the DICM folder). Try to import photos

Here's how to workaround this error while importing:1) First and foremost, make sure that the Photos app is open on the iPhone, and remains open throughout the process.2) Make sure the phone is NOT in Battery Saving mode (yellow collored battery).3) Make sure that the screen is turned on (ie. not locked)4) Now try to import from Windows Photos. I guarantee this will work.This is an iPhone software issue indeed. I have experienced this problem in a wide range of phones, from 5s to XS Max.  Turns out that the iPhone temporarily shuts down the photo import service in order to save resources.Good luck!
Thanks! That worked perfectly. As a workaround Onedrive and Google Photos also work perfectly. Although you have to pay for Onedrive and Google Photos is free.

I absolutely guarantee this is wrong wrong wrong.  Doesn't work for me.  Tried downloading latest iTunes and about 12 other solutions, nothing works.  I can upload from iPhone to PC about 10 photos at a time, sometimes.  Otherwise, fail.

Changing the options to "Keep Originals" also worked for me. I had 75 Gigs of free space on my phone so it wasn't a free space issue.Either way, this is seriously annoying because now I have a ton of HEIC files that I can't print with typical online printers and the codec didn't work for me. I think it wants me to buy another codec from microsoft for this codec to work.I did find a converter which works well and can drag and drop batches of photos... but it is still a very annoying process. https://imazing.com/heicI guess this is an iPhone problem in that it can't convert the files correctly...?

solutions: Windows server questions are out of scope for these consumer level forums. Please ask Windows Server questions in the Technet forums:https://social.technet.microsoft.com/forums/en-...

windows.symptom: How do I fix user profile error        Why do I keep getting user profile error.  I am also not able to sign it to office as it says I am not authorized.
solutions: Hi JoanSwanson1, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.What is the error exactly? You can share it with us, and detail a little more, in addition, you can check the information in this official link that contains indications on the subject, and verify if it is useful for you.https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/14039/...Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Have a nice day Regards, Marc M.

windows.symptom: Remove cortana from this computer as it will never be used.        Want to remove Cortana from my computer as it will never be used by me.
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you want to remove Cortana from your computer.  I would like to inform that since Cortana is an in-built process, removing Cortana completely from the computer is not possible. I would suggest you to provide a feedback in the MicrosoftFeedback Hub. The Microsoft Feedback Hub allows you to tell Microsoft about any problems, suggestions or thoughts to help us improve the Windows experience. However, if you are IT admin/professional, you may want to check the following settings. Note: Disabling Cortana might affect few other search features not to work properly. Refer the steps mentioned below: Before proceeding, I strongly recommend you to Create a system restore point. Using Registry editor: We can disable Cortana using Registry editor. Refer the steps mentioned below: Note:  Important this section, method, or task contains steps that tell you how to modify the registry. However, serious problems might occur if you modify the registry incorrectly. Therefore, make sure that you follow these steps carefully. For added protection, back up the registry before you modify it. Then, you can restore the registry if a problem occurs. Follow the steps to take backup of registry.  Press Windows Logo key + R, to openRun dialog box.Type regedit and click on OK.Now, navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search.(If you do not see Windows Search then, right click on Windows Key, select New > Key and rename the key as Windows Search) On the right pane, right click on an empty space, select New and selectDWORD (32—bit).Now, rename the newly created DWORD as AllowCortana.Double click on the DWORD, change the value to0. Restart the computer. Using Group Policy (Only for Windows 10 Pro/Enterprise): We can also disable Cortana using Group Policy editor. Refer the steps mentioned below: Press Windows key + R, to open Run dialog box.Type gpedit.msc and click on OK.Navigate to Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Component\Search.On the right pane, double click onAllow Cortana and select Disabled.Click on OK and restart the computer.  Let us know if you need any further assistance, we will be glad to help you. Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator

windows.symptom: Installing Windows 10, stuck at 0%        I'm installing Windows 10 for my mum.  I followed all the steps and got to the installing screen where it says to not turn off the computer and that it will restart several times. It has been at 0% for over 3 hours now.  Any suggestions?
solutions: Hi MaryDellea, I am Andrew an independent advisor. Are you using a recently made USB of Windows 10? If its any more than a few weeks old I suggest making a new one athttps://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/software-downlo... This issue could be due to a bad install file as well, which would mean you need a new USB made too.Is this a fresh install or are you upgrading an older Windows version? If you're upgrading you don't even need a USB, you can run the upgrade from within Windows through the media creation tool.Let me know your method if you made a new USB and still have problems, I can better help knowing which way you're going about installing.Take Care, Andrew

windows.symptom: Sony TV Monitor        How do you adjust screen size on the tv monitor so I can see the tool bar?
solutions: Hi, If the image is being display larger than the screen then first please check the resolution under Settings > System > Display. If there are no settings for "Overscan" available in your Monitor's display settings you may be able to adjust this from your graphics card's utility software. This depends on the GPU in your system however. If you are unsure it should be listed under Display Adapters in your Device Manager window.For Nvidia this is under Nvidia Control Panel > Adjust desktop size and position > Size tab > Enable Desktop Resizing > ResizeFor AMD Radeon Settings > Display > HDMI Scaling For Intel this is under, Intel HD Grahpics Control Panel > General Settings > Display > Customize Aspect Ratio under ScalingI hope that helps.

It's all working fine on there and it got as far as the "Check your PC" stage.Here it's saying "From the Your Phone app on your PC, select Send Notification. This will send the final permission to your phone."When I launch the Your Phone app on my PC, it just shows the app logo and does nothing. I can see my Android device in the devices section on https://account.microsoft.com/devices/

Hey Marc, I tried the solutions recommended on that page however it hasn't resolved my issue.

Marc, perhaps you could answer this related question for me: what "Send notification" is the Companion referring to?! I see that nowhere and this is maddening. As a recipient of a friends old iPhone, I am strongly considering switching to Apple as a lifelong Microsoft user because this is insane. Why the hell am I spending hours getting the ability to text from my PC set up?!

windows.symptom: Hiding desktop icons in Windows 10.        How do you hide the desktop icons in windows 10?
solutions: Hi, My name is Gary an independent advisor and I would be happy to help you out with your concern,1. Right click on an empty space on the desktop screen 2. Hover your cursor to the view option 3. Uncheck the show desktop icons Let me know how it goes. :)

Here are the bucket id's for the crash, I would like to know why it crashed, I didn't get enough information to see why it's crashing. Thank You--------------------------------------------(First Crash) 0x1E_c0000005_R_nt!ExFreePoolWithTag.--------------------------------------------(Second Crash) LKD_0x15E_FATAL_MINIPORT_ERROR_MINIPORT_REQUESTED_PLDR_4_0_IMAGE_Qcamain10x64.sys------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(Third Crash, There was no bucket id so I gave you info that might be helpful)Problem Event Name: LiveKernelEventCode: 144-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(Fourth Crash) CORRUPT_MODULELIST_0xEA (Bucket ID)---------------------------------------------(Fifth Crash)AV_STACKPTR_ERROR_nt!ExAllocatePoolWithTag-----------------------------------------------------(Sixth Crash)AV_nt!ExAllocatePoolWithTag--------------------------------
solutions: Hi Caleb_323 Possible caused by your network card device driver, however, to diagnose the underlying issue, I need to analyse your Mini-dump file(s):Open Windows File Explorer Navigate to C:\Windows\Minidump Copy any minidump files onto your Desktop, then zip those up Upload the zip file to the Cloud (OneDrive, DropBox . . . etc.), then choose to share those and get a share linkThen post the link here to the zip file, so we can take a look for you . . .
I cant get into the files, it says the dump file was "denied"
Hi Caleb_323 Right click those and choose Copy Then click on your Desktop and press Ctrl + V to create a copy of those on your Desktop to upload to OneDrive . . .
Ok, I might not get the zip files on here, but I will be back around 6 or 7 PM
Hi Caleb, no problem, I will be here . . .

solutions: Hi Gofarlow, Simply said, print spooler is a is a software program, an executable file which is responsible for managing all print tasks currently being sent to the printer or print server. It is a primary component of the printing interface and it is loaded at system startup and continues to run until the operating system is shut down. It is responsible for locating the correct printer driver, loading that driver, scheduling the print jobs etc.Please check this article for you to have the suggested guide on how you can fix this issue:https://blog.pcrisk.com/windows/12957-print-spo...Disclaimer: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information that might solve your current issue.Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products).Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.Let us know if this helped you out. Your feedback is much appreciated. Thanks and regards,
Thanks for the link. I went through each step and still having the same issue.I also created an ISO and installed it over the current version. Same issue.
Hi Gofarlow7186, Did you already tried updating or reinstalling your Printer's Driver as well?

I tried that as well. Once the Print Spooler stops the Print Driver install fails with an error that the Print Spooler service needs to be started.The DLL it defaults on is a C++ Redistributable package. I am going to try to get the latest x64 version and install it to see if it will replace that DLL.This is an odd one since everything else on this machine works great.

Hi, It may be useful to try to capture a user-mode dump of the spoolsv.exe crash to get more information on the crash which should show if any other modules are involved.You can configure Windows to create user-mode dumps. Create a System Restore Point first.If you copy and paste the following in Notepad and save as a .reg file (save with the .reg extension and give it any name such as dump.reg) then right-click the .reg file and select "Merge" to add to the registry, a .dmp file at the time spoolsv.exe crashes should be created in the C:\CrashDumps folder: Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Error Reporting\LocalDumps\spoolsv.exe]"DumpFolder"=hex(2):43,00,3a,00,5c,00,43,00,72,00,61,00,73,00,68,00,44,00,75,\ 00,6d,00,70,00,73,00,00,00 After spoolsv.exe crashes, can you then make the .dmp file available (provide link) via OneDrive or similar site?Here's a link on using OneDrive: http://windows.microsoft.com/en-ca/onedrive/sha...More info on collecting user-mode dumps: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb787181(VS.85).aspxTo stop the creation of the user mode dump files run the following registry file:Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 [-HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Error Reporting\LocalDumps\spoolsv.exe]

windows.symptom: Change search provider        How do I change the search provider in Windows 10?
solutions: Hi winedude6770 which browser? in edge navigate to the search providers site (e.g www.google.com) click the ellipsis (...) and select settings select advanced under address bar search click change search provider click on the discovered search provider and click set as default the option to change search provider will not be available if windows is in S-mode,to check go to settings -> system -> about under windows specifications, s-mode will be mentioned

windows.symptom: Trouble updating to Windows 1903        I have tried upgrading a few months ago and here I am again trying to update my computer from Windows 10 1809 to 1903 again. It's the same problem and I'll explain it. Basically, I think there's something to do with Windows not recognizing or working well with the GPU(s). I currently am running an external GPU (GTX 670) via ExpressCard EXP GDC to my laptop and am using an external display with it. The iGPU (Intel HD 3000) is connected to my internal laptop display and I left it enabled but disabled the dGPU (NVIDIA NVS 4200M) in case I ran into any problems (NVIDIA Optimus, etc.). And that all worked out fine but when I finished upgrading from Windows 10 1809 to 1903, my monitor/external display wasn't working (the eGPU was still on and connected) and only the internal display worked. So I went digging around and found out that in Device Manager, Windows disabled my eGPU because it was reporting problems and therefore that was why it recognized the eGPU but couldn't send a video signal to it to my monitor. However, the dGPU (the one I purposely disabled before) got re-enabled somehow and before I could do any more poking around I got a BSOD saying that there was a "video scheduler internal error".  So I restarted my computer and was left with the same results until Windows prompted me to the advanced restore settings after I booted it up and I restored my computer back to version 1809 (uninstalled the 1903 update) and everything worked fine. So I was wondering if there was a way to fix this so that I can update my computer successfully? Computer Specifications:2nd Generation Sandy Bridge Intel Core i7-2640M Processor (Dual-Core) 3.50 GHziGPU- Intel HD 3000dGPU- NVIDIA NVS 4200MeGPU- NVIDIA GTX 6708GB 1333MHz DDR3 RAM500GB Boot SSD, 250GB Secondary SSDDell Latitude E6520Windows 10 Version 1809
solutions: Hi Ethan. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Guardian Moderator here to help you.Disabling a driver in Device manager is not enough because a Version Upgrade reinstalls Windows so wipes all that out. You must disable it in BIOS/UEFI Setup, or else physically unplug it.I would manually upgrade to the latest version 1903 by opening the Media Creation Tool from this link:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m..., choose Download Tool Now, then open the tool and choose Upgrade This PC Now. This saves your files, apps and most settings in place, is the most stable method to change versions, brings your Updates current, resolves most problems. If any problems report back the verbatim error and number, then continue with these steps for overcoming Version Upgrade problems:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... If the Version has problems I will work with you to try to resolve them. If the problems are unfixable for now, you have ten days to roll it back in Recovery settings. You can then hide it so it doesn't try to reinstall following this same method:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta... Most problems are resolved by doing this gold standard Clean Install which should get you past all difficulties as it has millions of others who have followed the steps in this link and never come back to report another problem:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... . So read it over and see if its something you want to learn to do.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to rate my post, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Sound problems        Had some sound problems with importing a video into the Photo app.  If I import a photo to go in front of the video, the sound from the video disappears. Is there a way to use photo and video together to create a video with sound?
solutions: Hi LindsayPMilner, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.In this way, I have created some videos of that style quite simple, but they do the job, check the information here:https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405178...If it persists, and you suspect that it is an inappropriate operation of the application, let's do the following:1.- Repair/reset Photo App Press the Windows key + I >> Settings >> Applications >> Locate Photo App by scrolling down >> Click on Advanced Options >> Click on Repair, if the repair does not work, click on Reset.2.- If Reset does not work, then let's try reinstalling using Powershell Press the Windows key + X >> Click on Windows Powershell >> Copy the following command with the mouse button: Get-AppxPackage -allusers Microsoft.Windows.Photos | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$ ($ _. InstallLocation) \ AppXManifest.xml"} + Enter, wait for the operation to finish, then it is recommended to restart the computer3.- These are some of the official recommendations of Microsoft when the store or its applications are not working properly, you can emphasize updates.https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402749...Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Have a nice day Regards, Marc M.

windows.symptom: *FIX* Windows 10 not installing update after restart *FIX*        *Fix* located below*Issues : 1. When at Settings in Check for update, you click 'restart' to install updates and it doesn't go through with restarting computer anyway.2. You manually restart computer and update does not apply.*Fix* : Change your Computer's name and click on 'restart now'. A FEW MINUTES LOADING AND UPDATES WILL INSTALL! How to change Computer's name: Watch or Read https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpIAFmddHGoGo to Settings, go to System, scroll down to About, and on that page click Rename this PC, prompted to change name, CLICK Next, Click Resart Now! Will take few minutes to Restart.
